subject: Economics
title: Intergenerational Mobility: Can You Escape Your Birth?
description: Learn Intergenerational Mobility: Can You Escape Your Birth? in one minute.

hook.text: A child born poor in Denmark has a 12% chance of staying poor as an adult. In the US, that chance is 40%. Same ambition.

buildup.text: Social mobility measures how much your parents' income predicts yours. High mobility means anyone can rise.

discovery.text: The 'Great Gatsby Curve' shows that countries with higher inequality also have lower mobility.

twist.text: The American Dream is statistically more achievable in Scandinavia than in America.

climax.text: Mobility isn't about individual effort â€” it's about systems.

punchline.text: Meritocracy is a beautiful idea. The data says it's mostly a myth.

quiz.question: What does the 'Great Gatsby Curve' show?
options: Countries with higher inequality tend to have lower social mobility
